title: Global basketball shoe sales 2012 - 2013 , by NBA player
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Quarters on X-axis for 2 groups 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding SOME LABEL.
Over the 5 Quarters, the SOME LABEL for both 2013 and 2012 have lowered.
Out of all 2 groups, 2013 had the highest SOME LABEL in Quarter Michael Jordan and 2012 had the lowest SOME LABEL in Quarter Kevin Durant.
In Quarter Michael Jordan, 2013 had the maximum SOME LABEL and it saw the lowest in Quarter Derrick Rose out of all 5 Quarters.

max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 5 different Quarters on X-axis for 2 groups 2012, and 2013. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding SOME LABEL.
Over the 5 Quarters, the SOME LABEL for both 2013 and 2012 have lowered.
Quarter Michael Jordan had the maximum SOME LABEL among all 2 groups, and it was for 2013. The minimum SOME LABEL was observed in Quarter Kevin Durant for 2012.
In Quarter Michael Jordan, 2013 had the maximum SOME LABEL and it saw the lowest in Quarter Derrick Rose out of all 5 Quarters.
Quarter Michael Jordan and Derrick Rose had the biggest gap of 2460.0 between the highest and lowest SOME LABEL found for 2013.
Among the groups, 2012 had the biggest difference in SOME LABEL. Where the maximum SOME LABEL was 57.14 times larger than the minimum SOME LABEL.
On average, the Quarter Michael Jordan had the highest SOME LABEL for all 2 groups 2012, and 2013. Whereas Derrick Rose had the lowest average SOME LABEL.
